title: Vietta Garr Plays the Piano
Scopenote: Vietta Garr, maid of the Trumans, plays the piano.

title: President Harry S. Truman and John Russell Young at White House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) and J. Russell Young, D. C. Commissioner, reading papers, in front of White House.  First Lady Bess Truman is in background.  President Truman's handwriting is on matte of photo saying "From Gen. S. B. Akin, Chief Signal Officer."  Original photo is in autograph file in vault.

title: Portrait of David Willock Wallace
Scopenote: Portrait of David Willock Wallace, father of Bess Wallace Truman.

title: Bess Wallace Baby Portrait
Scopenote: Portrait of Bess Wallace Truman as a baby.  From: Natalie (Mrs. Frank) Wallace.

title: Knights Templar Portrait of David W. Wallace
Scopenote: Portrait of David Willock Wallace in his Knights Templar uniform.
Institutional Creator: W.A. Hare and Co., Independence, MO

title: Bess Wallace and Mary Paxton
Scopenote: Young Bess Wallace (left) and her friend, Mary Paxton. Bess Wallace is wearing a hat with a large ruffle and feather on the top.  Donor: Mary Paxton Keeley.

title: Stereograph of Renault Tanks Going to the Front
Scopenote: Stereograph of a line of Renault tanks traveling along a French road going to the front.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Officers Practicing the "Short Point Stab" at an American Army Camp
Scopenote: Stereograph of officers practicing the "short point stab" at an American Army Camp.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph View of the Deck of the USS Pennsylvania, a World War I Battleship
Scopenote: Stereograph view of the deck of the USS Pennsylvania, a World War I advance battleship.  View is looking aft from the bow of the ship.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Submarines, Battleships and Torpedo Boats in San Diego Bay
Scopenote: Stereograph of submarines, battleships and torpedo boats anchor in San Diego Bay, California.  One submarine has the marking "K8."  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Wrecked World War I Zeppelin
Scopenote: Stereograph image of wrecked and burned German Zeppelin, being inspected by French troops. This is during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of World War I French Field Hospital using X-ray Machine
Scopenote: Stereograph of French Field Hospital using a X-Ray machine to locate a bullet in a wounded soldier during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Colonial (Morocco) Cavalry in Paris
Scopenote: Stereograph of French Colonial (Morocco) cavalry marching in Paris, France during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Sarajevo, Yugoslavia
Scopenote: Location in Sarajevo, Yugoslavia, where the Crown Prince Francis Ferdinand and the Duchess of Hohenberg were shot, setting in motion World War I. Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: World War I Stereograph of a Plenary Session of the Peace Conference at the French Foreign Office
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of a plenary session of the Peace Conference at the French Foreign Office on the Qual D'Orsay, Paris.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French President Poincare and Marshall Joffre on the Somme Front
Scopenote: Stereograph of French President Raymond Poincare and Marshall Joseph Joffre visiting officers' quarters on the Somme Front.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: World War I Stereograph of No Man's Land, Saloniki Front
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of No Man's Land, sea of barbed wire in front of the Bulgarian lines, Saloniki Front, showing the spiked poles and the layout of the barbed wire.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: Stereograph of Decomposed Human Remains in No Man's Land, Chemin des Dames, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of decomposed human remains of a British soldier around Chemin des Dames, France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French 320mm Artillery Battery near Reims, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of French 320mm artillery battery (four guns) near Reims, France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of German Soldiers Dead in a Trench in the La Bassee Area
Scopenote: Stereograph of German soldiers dead in a trench in the La Bassee Area southwest of Lille about 10 miles from the Belgian border.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of No Man's Land near Lens, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of No Man's Land near Lens, France, showing the desolation and destruction.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: Stereograph of Cuirassier Guards Marching to the Parade Grounds, Berlin
Scopenote: Stereograph of parade of Cuirassier Guards marching to the parade grounds, Berlin, Germany.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Reserve Officers Building Barbed Wire Entanglements at Fort Sheridan, Illinois
Scopenote: Stereograph of Reserve Officers building barbed wire entanglements - reserve officers in training camp, Ft. Sheridan, Illinois.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of 3000 American Soldiers Standing in Formation
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of 3,000 American soldiers standing in formation.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of a Battered British tank at Cambrai
Scopenote: Stereograph of a ripped and battered to death by the enemy - a derelict tank at Cambrai.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Wrecked Submarine at Burges, Belgium
Scopenote: Stereograph of a wrecked submarine at Burges, Belgium, a German submarine base.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of General Pershing and Marshall Joffre, Governor's Garden, Paris, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of United States General John J. Pershing and Marshall Beauchesne Joffre of France talking in the Governor's Garden, Paris, France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of U.S. Observation Airplane on Western Front
Scopenote: Stereograph of U.S. observation airplanes on the Western Front in France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Bombed Allied Supply Wagons
Scopenote: Stereograph of enemy airmen successfully bombing one of our supply trains (Allies) - Official Report.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Soldiers Resting in the Trenches
Scopenote: Stereograph of French soldiers resting in the trenches.  Donor; George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: World War I Stereograph of French troops on Parade in Paris
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of French troops on parade in Paris, France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Doughboys of the 89th Division resting before review, Treves, Germany
Scopenote: Stereograph of American soldiers of the 89th Division (the "mid-west" Division).  Trained by Major General Leonard Wood and led in combat by General William M. Wright in the St. Mihiel operations.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Soldiers Searching Ruins During World War I
Scopenote: Stereograph of French solders searching ruins somewhere in France after the German retreat during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Camouflaged Trenches in Chemin Dea Dames Sector
Scopenote: Stereograph of camouflaged trenches in Chemin Dea Dames Sector in France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Destroyed Marne Bridge with Red Cross Train Wreck
Scopenote: Stereograph of tangles ruins of the Marne Bridge blown up by Germans and a Red Cross train wreck.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of American Soldiers in France Learning to use Gas Masks
Scopenote: Stereograph of American soldiers in France learning to correctly use gas masks.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Navy Sailors at the Great Lakes Training Station
Scopenote: Stereograph of Navy sailors on the parade grounds at the Great Lakes Training Station along the banks of Lake Michigan.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Projectile for the 12 inch Disappearing Gun
Scopenote: Stereograph of a projectile and power for the 12 inch disappearing gun produced the United States.  Each shell weighed 1070 pounds and a typical powder load was 325 pounds.  This photo was take at Fortress Monroe, Virginia.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French "75" Gun in Action
Scopenote: Stereograph of the French "75" gun in action against battle planes during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of German Observation Balloon Pierced by Incendiary Bullets
Scopenote: Stereograph of German observation balloon shot down by incendiary bullets from a American plane.  A German soldier is in a small wicker basket under the balloon.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Wounded Belgian in Hospital During World War I
Scopenote: Stereograph of a ghastly glimpse of a wounded Belgian in a hospital in Antwerp, Belgium, being attended by nurse.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Hoisting Shell into Large French Gun
Scopenote: Stereograph of French soldiers loading a large shell into "Grannie," a large French artillery piece during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of German Zeppelin Flying over German Town
Scopenote: Stereograph of German zeppelin flying over a German town in the lower valley of the Rhine during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Russian Troops During World War I
Scopenote: Large mass of Russian troops on review during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Allies Trenches along the coast of Flanders during World War I
Scopenote: Stereograph of trenches of the Allies among the dunes and brambles on the coast of Flanders during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of U. S. Army tractor (bulldozer)negotiating the steep declivities of the Rhine at Coblenz
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of a U. S. Armey tractor (bulldozer) negotiating the steep declivities of the Rhine at Coblenz.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Alincourt, France, German Ammunition camp Destroyed by Allied Airman
Scopenote: Stereograph of German ammunition camp in Alincourt, France, destroyed by Allied Airmen. Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Desolation of Berry au Bac, France, after Four Years of Fighting
Scopenote: Stereograph of desolation of Berry au Bac, France, after four years of fighting.  Part of the battleground along the Chemin des Dames.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Soldier Observing Desolate Waste on Chemin des Dames Battlefield, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of solder observing desolate waste on Chemin Des Dames Battlefield, France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Cavalry Horses Swimming River in Northern France
Scopenote: Stereograph of French cavalry horses swimming the river in northern France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of American Soldiers Doing Daily Calisthenics
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of American soldiers doing daily calisthenics.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Reserves Watching a Column of Soldiers Marching to the Front
Scopenote: Stereograph of World War I French reserves watching in the distance a single file of French soldiers marching toward the front.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of the Belleau Woods where the Marine Brigade of the 2nd Division Defeated the Germans
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of the area of the Belleau Woods where the Marine Brigade of the 2nd Division met the Germans and pushed them back to the valley seen through the trees.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Bridge over the Marne River at Chateau-Thierry, France
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of a temporary bridge spanning the Marne River in the town of Chateau-Thierry, France.  View is from the south looking towards city hall and the heights beyond.  This is the place where the Americans first engaged the Germans.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of "Parade Rest" Training for Navy Sailors
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of "Parade Rest" training for Navy sailors.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of British Dirigible R-34 at Minneola
Scopenote: Stereograph of British dirigible R-34 at Minneola during World War I. Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French 155 mm Artillery During World War I
Scopenote: Stereograph of a French 155 mm gun trained on German trenches during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Wounded During World War I
Scopenote: Stereograph of bringing in wounded on French front after the Battle Ablain St. Nazaire, showing stretcher bearers and aid station.  Donor; George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: Stereograph of The 48th Highlanders of Toronto
Scopenote: Stereograph of the 48th Highlanders of Toronto, Canada, marching during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: World War I Stereograph of American Troops Marching Through London
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of American troops marching through London on their way home from France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of General Pershing Decorating Officers of the 89th Division
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of General John J. Pershing decorating officers of the 89th Division at Treves, Germany.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: Stereograph of Bombed Out Church at Lucy-le-Bocage
Scopenote: Stereograph of the bombed out church at Lucy-le-Bocage showing the statue of the crucifix still standing amid the total ruin.  The American 2nd and 26th divisions passed by on their way to the fighting in the Belleau Woods.  The 2nd division erected a "Indian Head" plague on a large boulder at the site.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.  Donor; George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: Stereograph of Allied Troops in North Compiegne, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of Allied troops in the trenches waiting for the signal to attack in North Compiegne, France.  There is a German artillery barrage in progress.  World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Abandoned German Supply Depot in Soupier France
Scopenote: Stereograph of French Soldiers making an inventory of an abandoned German Supply depot in Soupier, France during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Italian Trenches Along the Austro-Italian Front
Scopenote: Stereograph of Italian trenches built along the Austro-Italian front, built along the Vallone Ridge after being taken from the Austrians.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: Stereograph of British Anti-Aircraft Gun in Action on Balkan Front
Scopenote: Stereograph of British anti-aircraft gun in action on Balkan Front.  It is camouflaged and mounted on automobile.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of the Cathedrals at Reims, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of the world renowned Cathedral at Reims, France, ruined by the Germans after they were driven out in September, 1914.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Officers Inspecting Pontoon Bridge
Scopenote: Stereograph of French officers inspecting a nearly completed pontoon bridge in the French sector of the western front.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Fallen Scottish Soldiers who Fought on Flanders Field
Scopenote: Stereograph of dead Scottish soldiers on the Flanders Field battlefield. Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of a British Heavy Tank
Scopenote: Stereograph of a British heavy tank giving a demonstration in America, traveling through a smoke screen.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of American Soldiers in Camp Getting Some Sun
Scopenote: World War I stereograph "Sunshine keeps our soldiers healthy. Daily sunning of equipment.  Image from Camp Oglethorpe."

title: Stereograph of four United States Submarines During Construction in Dry Dock
Scopenote: Stereograph of four United States submarines during construction in a dry dock at a government Navy yard.  One may be the USS Schley.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Artillery in Action during World War I
Scopenote: Stereograph of watching "the Crimson Chorus of the Guns" playing to the enemy.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Artillery Shells Bursting in Ruined French Village
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of artillery shells bursting in ruined French village.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Dead Germans Amidst Wire Entanglements
Scopenote: Stereograph of dead German soldiers amidst wire entanglements and concrete defenses.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Workers Making Bread for British Soldiers
Scopenote: Stereograph of men making bread for British soldiers at Camp Scene, France.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Dog Returning to First Aid Squad
Scopenote: Stereograph of trained dog returning to first aid squad carrying helmet of wounded soldier. Dogs were trained to locate wounded soldiers and guide medics to their location during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereoscope of Destroyed German Machine Gun Cupola
Scopenote: Stereoscope image of destroyed German steel machine gun cupola during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of the Mur Tschoffen Wall in Dinant, Belgium
Scopenote: Stereograph image of a family of five standing in front of the Mur Tschoffen wall in Dinant, Belgium, the scene of a massacre of 116 citizens by Germans in August, 1914 during World War I.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of 1900 German prisoners Marching after being Captured by Americans
Scopenote: Stereograph of 1900 World War I German prisoners marching after being captured by Americans.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of the Place des Halles in St. Mihiel, France
Scopenote: Stereograph of the Place des Halles (market square) in St. Mihiel, France. The city was retaken by the Americans on September 13, 1918.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of American Flag Flying over the Ehrenbrietstein Fortress on the Rhine
Scopenote: Stereograph of the American flag flying over the Ehrenbrietstein Fortress on the Rhine, Germany.  Scene inspired Major Joseph Mills Hanson of the Historical Branch of the HQ Division of the A.E.F. to write a poem.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Field Guns on the Oise River during World War I
Scopenote: Stereograph of French Field Guns on the Oise River during World War I.  These are some of the largest field guns used during the war; very difficult to move because of their weight.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Scottish Soldiers in Their Trenches
Scopenote: Stereograph of Scottish soldiers in their trenches awaiting a counterattack, with gas masks and supplies displayed.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of West Beach, Gallipoli, Scene of British Landing and Battles
Scopenote: Stereograph of West Beach, Gallipoli, showing British landings and supplies.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of British Battleship Indomitable
Scopenote: Stereograph of the British battleship Indomitable which sunk the German Battle Cruiser Bluecher on January 24, 1915.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of French Troops and Transports on "The Sacred Road" during the Battle of Verdun
Scopenote: Stereograph of French troops and transports on "The Sacred Road (La Voie Sacree) during the Battle of Verdun, 1915.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of President Wilson Addressing Congress
Scopenote: Stereograph of President Woodrow Wilson addressing Congress on the question of international peace and imminent dangers of war with Germany.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Army Marching in Chicago, August 4, 1917
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of Army soldiers marching in Chicago, Illinois, August 4, 1917.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of captured German Machine Guns on the Road from Villars-Cotterets to Soissons
Scopenote: Stereograph of captured German Maxim machine guns with a hillock of reserve ammunition on the road from Villars-Cotterets to Soissons.  Must have been taken between July 18th and 22nd, 1918.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66.

title: Stereograph of Gravesite of Quentin Roosevelt, Youngest son of Theodore Roosevelt
Scopenote: Stereograph of the gravesite of Lieutenant Quentin Roosevelt, youngest son of Theodore Roosevelt.  Quentin was a member of the 95th American Aero Squadron, First Pursuit Group.  He was killed in aerial combat on July 14, 1918 at Chamery, near Reims.

title: Stereograph of Victory Day Celebrations, July 14th, 1919, Arch of Triumph, Paris
Scopenote: World War I stereograph of Victory Day celebrations and parade at the Arch of Triumph in Paris, France on July 14, 1919.  Donor: George J. Paulson to HST 3-3-66

title: Bryce B. Smith speaking over KMBC Radio
Scopenote: Bryce B. Smith, Mayor of Kansas City, Missouri, speaking over KMBC Radio.

title: Bryce B. Smith, in baseball cap
Scopenote: Kansas City, Missouri Mayor Bryce B. Smith, in baseball cap, throwing a baseball.

title: World War II plane
Scopenote: Heinkel He 177 Greif airplane developed by Germany for use in World War II. This was the second HE 177 A-0 production prototype (A-02) with broad-bladed propellers, bearing radio code "DL+AQ." There is a swastika on the tail.

title: Battery D Reunion, 1944
Scopenote: Battery D Reunion at the Ambassador Hotel, in Kansas City.  This photo is signed in the corner by Senator Harry S. Truman "Best wishes, Harry S. Truman."  Original photograph is filed in autographed photo file. This picture was in a photo album of Battery D at the inauguration in 1949, a gift of Frank Kuntz.
Institutional Creator: Anderson Photo Co., Kansas City, MO

title: President Harry S. Truman Dines with Friends and Associates in Independence
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman enjoys a meal with a group of politicians and notables at the home of Mayor Roger T. Sermon in Independence, Missouri.  Seated from left to right around the table are: Edgar Hinde, J. Leonard Reinsch, unidentified man, unidentified man, Matthew Connelly, Captain James Vardaman, Mayor Sermon, President Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross, unidentified man, General Harry Vaughan, Ted Marks, James Pendergast, and C.C. Bundschu.

title: B-29s in flight
Scopenote: B-29s in flight, dropping bombs.  This is from an album about B-29 airplanes.

title: Douglas MacArthur
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur, Commander in Chief, Far East.

title: William A. Brophy at His Desk
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs, William A. Brophy, sits at his desk in his office in the Department of the Interior.
Related Collection: Brophy, William A.  and Brophy, Sophie Aberle Papers

title: William A. Brophy with Blackfoot Indians
Scopenote: Commissioner of Indian Affairs William A. Brophy (third from the left) outside the Department of Interior Building in Washington, D. C., with a group of unidentified Blackfoot Indians.
Related Collection: Brophy, William A.  and Brophy, Sophie Aberle Papers

title: President Truman's homecoming to Independence, MO
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's homecoming to Independence, Missouri.  He is being honored by the city in the auditorium of the Reorganized Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints.

title: President Truman's homecoming
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's homecoming to Independence, Missouri. He is posing in the back yard of the Truman home with members of the Independence Chamber of Commerce.

title: Navajo tribal council
Scopenote: Navajo tribal council meeting.
Related Collection: Brophy, William A.  and Brophy, Sophie Aberle Papers

title: Makeshift school in Greece
Scopenote: An improvised open-air school in Thessaly, Greece, after World War II.  From an album, "Greece Before and After the War."

title: House in rural Greece after the war
Scopenote: A makeshift rural home in Epirus, Greece after World War II. From an album, "Greece Before and After the War."

title: Soup kitchen in Greece
Scopenote: A soup kitchen for orphans in Servia, Greece. From an album, "Greece Before and After the War."

title: Truman on White House grounds smelling flowers
Scopenote: President Truman on the White House grounds, stopping to smell the flowers.  This is an award winning photograph by female photographer Marion Carpenter.

title: Truman addressing the United Nations
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman addresses the General Assembly of the United Nations as they meet at their temporary headquarters in Flushing Meadows, New York.

title: Orphaned children in Greece
Scopenote: Orphaned children in Greece, looking at a cross that marks the remains of their family.  From an album, "Greece Before and After the War."

title: Harriman and Anderson Consult with EUCOM and OMGUS Officials on European Economy
Scopenote: Secretary of Commerce Averell Harriman and Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson meet with European Command (EUCOM) Commander General Lucius D. Clay and other high military officials in Berlin, Germany, to discuss the postwar economy of western Europe. Shown left to right are: EUCOM Government Affairs Adviser Dr. Henry Parkman; EUCOM Deputy Military Governor Maj. Gen. Frank A. Keating; Secretary Anderson; Gen. Clay; Secretary Harriman; EUCOM Economic Adviser Maj. Gen. William H. Draper, Jr.; EUCOM Financial Adviser Jack Bennett; and Director of Economic Division of the Office of Military Government for Germany, United States (OMGUS) Lawrence Wilkinson.
Institutional Creator: Office of Military Government for Germany (U.S.)

title: Truman's desk in the Oval Office
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman Oval Office in the White House as it looked in 1947 after it was redecorated.  This view shows President Truman's desk.

title: Portrait of Clark Clifford
Scopenote: Portrait of Clark Clifford, Special Counsel to the President.  From the album, "Christmas Greetings to the President from the Staff".

title: Truman and Vaughan leaving the Presidential plane
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (near end of steps) and General Harry H. Vaughan leaving the Presidential plane.

Scopenote: Color picture of the sitting room of the U.S.S. Williamsburg.

title: U.S.S. Williamsburg office
Scopenote: Color picture of an office aboard the U.S.S. Williamsburg.

title: Room of the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: Color picture of the interior of the U.S.S. Williamsburg.

title: Room of the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: Color picture of the interior of the U.S.S. Williamsburg.

title: Margaret Truman singing
Scopenote: This picture of Margaret Truman was taken while she entertained at a Correspondents Association Dinner.

title: President Truman Leaves the Governor's Palace in Colonial Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, John D. Rockefeller III, and another unidentified person walk away from the Governor's Palace in Colonial Williamsburg, Virginia.

title: President Truman Speaks at the College of William and Mary
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands at the lectern during his speech during an honorary degree ceremony on Canadian-American Day at the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Virginia. Governor General of Canada Alexander of Tunis, W&M president John Edwin Pomfret, and Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King are seated in the front row. The Wren Building is in the background.

title: President Truman Receives Honorary Degree from the College of William and Mary
Scopenote: In a ceremony outside of the Wren Building, President Harry S. Truman receives an honorary degree from the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Virginia. All others are unidentified.

title: Canadian-American Day Ceremony at the College of William and Mary
Scopenote: The official party celebrating Canadian-American Day gathers in the Great Hall of the Wren Building at the College of William and Mary in Williamsburg, Virginia. Left to right: Virginia Governor William Tuck, unidentified, W&M president John Edwin Pomfret, Senator Alben Barkley, Governor General of Canada Alexander of Tunis, Canadian Prime Minister Mackenzie King, 2 unidentified, President Harry S. Truman, and 2 unidentified.

title: Bess and Margaret Truman at Plowing Match
Scopenote: First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) and daughter Margaret Truman (second from right) attending the National Plowing Match in Dexter, Iowa. This photo was taken just before President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) gave a campaign speech at the plowing match. All other people on stage are not identified.  From the album, The President's Trip to Iowa.

title: Thomas Dewey speaking in Springfield, Missouri
Scopenote: New York Governor and Republican Presidential candidate Thomas E. Dewey (second from left) in Springfield, Missouri during the 1948 presidential campaign. On the left is Governor Dewey's wife, Frances. Others are unidentified.  From: Kenneth Sender.

title: Governor Dewey in Springfield, Missouri
Scopenote: New York Governor and Republican Presidential candidate Thomas E. Dewey (waving from train) in Springfield, Missouri during the 1948 presidential campaign.   From: Kenneth Sender.

title: Governor Dewey on the train in Springfield, Missouri
Scopenote: New York Governor and Republican Presidential candidate Thomas E. Dewey (second from left) in Springfield, Missouri during the 1948 presidential campaign. On the left is Governor Dewey's wife, Frances. Others are unidentified.  From: Kenneth Sender.

title: Truman Family Leaving Chicago Stadium
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, and First Lady Bess W. Truman (seated, left to right) are riding in an open car as they leave Chicago Stadium, Chicago, Illinois. President Truman delivered a campaign speech there. All others are unidentified.  From:  The album "Victory Visit, the Picture Story of President Truman's Chicago Reception."

title: Lovely color tinted head and shoulders portrait of Bess Truman
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of Bess Truman, color tinted by oil paint.  (Same photo as 59-794, only that is autographed and black and white; and 2009-1570, only it is black and white).

title: Portrait of Matthew Connelly
Scopenote: Matthew J. Connelly, Chief investigator for the Senate Special Committee to Investigate the National Defense Program (the Truman Committee), 1941-44, Executive Assistant to Senator and Vice President Truman, July 1944-April 1945; and Appointments Secretary to the President, 1945-53.

title: Painting of Truman in Masonic Regalia
Scopenote: A photograph of the painting by Greta Kempton of President Harry S. Truman in his Masonic regalia as the Grand Master of Missouri.

title: Portrait of J. Howard McGrath
Scopenote: Portrait of Senator J. Howard McGrath.

title: President Harry S. Truman with Legislators
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) waves his hat as he leaves the White House for the Capitol on Inauguration Day with Congressman John W. McCormack (center) and Senator Carl Hayden. The photo is autographed by all three men.

title: President Truman and Cabinet at Blair House
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and his cabinet posing at Blair House.  Left to right seated:  Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson; Secretary of State Dean Acheson; President Truman; Vice President Alben Barkley; Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder; Attorney General Tom Clark.  Back row:  Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug; Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson; Secretary of Agriculture Charles Brannan; Secretary of Commerce Charles Sawyer; and Secretary of Labor Maurice Tobin.

title: Portrait of Charles Brannan
Scopenote: Portrait of Charles Brannan, Secretary of Agriculture, 1948-1953.  Original is inscribed outside the photograph: "To Steve Mitchell with best regards.  Charles F. Brannan."

title: Mrs. Truman and Gael Galvin
Scopenote: Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (left) receives a Margaret Truman doll from Gael Galvin, daughter of Under Secretary of Labor Michael J. Galvin.

title: Mrs. Truman with the Galvins
Scopenote: Mrs. Michael Galvin (left) with Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (right) with the Galvin's son, who is dressed in a community chest uniform at a dinner given by the Washington, D. C. chapter of the Community Chest.

title: Mrs. Truman with the Galvins
Scopenote: Mrs. Michael Galvin (left) with Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (right) with the Galvin's son, who is dressed in a community chest uniform at a dinner given by the Washington, D. C. chapter of the Community Chest.

title: David Stowe
Scopenote: David Stowe, administrative assistant to the President, relaxes on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: Photographers at Key West
Scopenote: A group of photographers at Key West, Florida, taking pictures.  They are at a picnic at the Little White House.  After the picnic, President Harry S. Truman (not pictured) had a press conference.

title: Members of Truman staff in Key West
Scopenote: Picnic lunch in the garden of the Little White House in Key West, Florida. From left to right: Donald Dawson, Stephen Spingarn, Charles Ross, William Hassett, and Margaret Truman (holding a camera).

title: Truman family and staff, Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Group shot of the presidential party for the eighth trip to Key West, Florida.  Front row, left to right: John Steelman, Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman, President Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman, and William Hassett.  Back row, left to right: Stephen Spingarn, General Robert Landry, Admiral Robert Dennison, Stanley Woodward, Charles Ross, General Harry Vaughan, General Wallace Graham, and David Niles.

title: Truman Attends Easter Service in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and other members of his party attend Easter sunrise church service while on vacation in Key West, Florida. Seated in the front row, from left to right: Admiral Robert Dennison, Captain C.C. Adell, President Truman, Margaret Truman, and Dr. John Steelman. Second row, left to right: Stanley Woodward, Donald Dawson, David Niles, and Press Secretary Charles Ross. All others are unidentified.

title: Mr. Truman is greeted at Eglin Air Force Base
Scopenote: Mr. Truman is greeted by APG Commanding General Major General W. E. Kepner and Hon. W. Stuart Symington during his visit to Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Twenty-seven 500-pound GP bombs are unloaded during demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: Twenty-seven 500-pound GP bombs are unloaded by two four engine jet propelled B-45 "Tornado" light bombers. This occurred during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida. From: The album, The U.S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Again the versatile F-84 fires at target in aerial firepower demonstration
Scopenote: Again the versatile F-84 shows its wares as it spews the beginning of its thirty-two five-inch rocket payload.  This occurred during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: B-26 Invaders climaxing a low level strafing during demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: B-26 Invaders shown climaxing low level strafing and bombing run directed at smoke enveloped tank target during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Jet fighters of the United States Air Force
Scopenote: Jet fighters of the United States Air Force composed of:  front to rear:  four F-80s, two F-84s and four F-86s.  This was taken during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: The 'Saber Dancers' at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: The 'Sabre Dancers', another air force precision formation team pass in a tight wing-to-wing diamond pattern. This was taken during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Mr. Truman and Party are Escorted to Awaiting Automobile at Eglin Field
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, and their party are escorted by Major General William E. Kepner through an air police honor guard to an awaiting automobile at Eglin Field in Florida. The plane "Independence" can be seen in the background. From: The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: President Truman and party are driven to their billets at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: Beaming happily, left to right in car:  President Harry S. Truman, General W. E. Kepner and Secretary of the Air Force Stuart Symington, are driven off to their billets.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: President Truman and Party Witness the Airpower Demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, Major General William E. Kepner, and party witness the aerial firepower demonstration from spectator stands at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida. From: The Album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: A lone B-45 "Tornado" bomber
Scopenote: A lone B-45 bomber losing part of its load of 30 five-inch High Velocity Aerial Rockets. President Truman witnessed the demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: An F-80 fires during a demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: A second F-80 follows his predecessors in smearing the target area with the fire from two Napal fire bombs.  This occurred during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: An F-84 scores a direct hit during a demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: An F-84 scores a direct hit on a condemned aircraft with several bursts of his six .50 caliber machine guns. This occurred during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida. From: The album, The U.S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: The B-47, B-45, and F-86 pass overhead
Scopenote: A portrayal of the Air Force's latest here as the B-47, B-45, and F-86 pass overhead in close formation during the demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Parabundles are released
Scopenote: Parabundles are released from the after bay of the new C-97 super cargo aircraft. This was taken during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Simulated air-sea rescue operations at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: Simulated air-sea rescue operation are shown as an H-5 helicopter lifts a "stranded flyer" from his life raft. This was part of a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: A giant B-47 soars during a demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: Suspended on a plume-like pinnacle of smoke, a giant B-47 soars steeply into the sky using Jet  Assisted Take-off. This was during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Party escorted by APG Deputy Commander Colonel M. C. Woodbury, at Eglin Air Force Base
Scopenote: Left to right, escorted by APG Deputy Commander Colonel M. C. Woodbury (far right) are:  Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, Secretary of the Navy Frances Matthews, Canadian Minister of National Defense Brooke Claxton, Secretary Frank Pace, Senator Homer Ferguson, and Admiral Forest P. Sherman. They are at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The Album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: A B-50 Superbomber releases a lifeboat
Scopenote: A B-50 Superbomber releases a lifeboat via parachute to some flyer who might still be in a small rubber boat. This was during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: An SA-16 climbing rapidly into the sky during a demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: Climbing rapidly into the sky, an SA-16 takes full advantage of its newly adopted Jet Assisted Take-off aid.  This demonstration for President Truman was at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: A tiny JB-2 is set airborne by a B-50 superfortress bomber
Scopenote: A tiny JB-2 (Jet Bomb *2) is set airborne by its mother, a B-50 superfortress bomber.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Stuart Symington, General Vandenberg and Major General Kepner at Eglin Air Force Base
Scopenote: Left to Right:  W. Stuart Symington, General Hoyt Vandenberg, and Major General W. E. Kepner, APG Commander at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  This was taken during a visit of President Truman to the base.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Honorable Stephen Early and General Omar Bradley at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: Honorable Stephen Early and General Omar Bradley are escorted by APG Deputy Commander M. C. Woodbury upon arrival at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.   From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: The USAF's famed "Aerojet" stunt team
Scopenote: The USAF's famed "Aerojet" stunt team passing by in one of their precision formations, an Aerojet trademark. This was taken during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The Album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: An F-84 "Thunderjet" spurts forth an aerial rocket
Scopenote: An F-84 "Thunderjet" spurts forth a deadly 11.75 inch aerial rocket. The F-84 carries four such destroyers. This occurred during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida. From: The album, The U.S. Air force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: An F-80 "Shooting Star" bombs a target during a demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: This F-80 "Shooting Star" jettisons his two 165 gallon Napalm-filled tanks at target. This occurred during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: View of President Truman's  arrival at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: View of President Harry S. Truman's arrival at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida for Joint Orientation Conference. He arrived on his airplane, the Independence.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: View of arrival of cabinet members and party at Eglin Air Force Base
Scopenote: Overall view of arrival of cabinet members and party at Eglin for Joint Orientation Conference. President Truman also attended the event.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: President Truman waves to an assembled crowd at Eglin Air Force Base
Scopenote: President Truman waves to an assembled crowd here at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida, shortly after his big "Independence" rolls to a halt.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Parafrag bombs are scattered earthward during demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base
Scopenote: Parafrag bombs are scattered earthward at a ship target from the racks of this conventional type B-26 Invader during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.

title: Two speedy jet fighters
Scopenote: Two speedy jet fighters, the F-86 (lower left)and F-84 (upper left) pull out of simulated attach on B-50 bomber.  This was taken at a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Some of the Air Force's foremost aircraft
Scopenote: Some of the Air Force's foremost aircraft winging by in review from large to small:  B-36, B-29, B-17, B-26, F-51. This was taken during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: A giant B-47 soars into the sky during a demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: A giant B-47 soars into the sky during a demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: View of Joint Orientation Conference grandstand at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida
Scopenote: View of Joint Orientation Conference grandstand at Air Proving Ground Bombing Range 52, taken by helicopter during full scale firepower demonstration at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida. (APG Photo). From: The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: A giant B-36 bomber
Scopenote: A giant B-36 appears with its newly adopted jet pods, each of which carries two engines, a total of four. This photograph was taken during a demonstration for President Truman at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.  From:  The album, The U. S. Air Force presents Aerial Firepower Demonstration.

title: Main and West Lexington Streets in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Nice photo of Main and Lexington Streets in Independence, Missouri.  Donor:  Albert Schoenberg, realtor. Album containing photographs of improvements around the square in Independence.

title: Main and Lexington Streets, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Nice photo of Main and Lexington Streets, looking southwest, in Independence, Missouri.  Donor:  Albert Schoenberg, realtor.  Album containing photographs of improvements around the square in Independence.

title: 219 N. Delaware, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Photograph of the home of President Harry S. Truman in Independence, Missouri.  From an album containing photographs of improvements around the Independence, Missouri town square.  Donor:  Albert Schoenreg.

title: Louis Johnson, General MacArthur, and General Bradley in Tokyo, Japan
Scopenote: Secretary of Defense Louis Johnson, General Douglas MacArthur, and General Omar Bradley salute the colors during a review held on the palace plaza, Tokyo Japan, in honor of Mr. Johnson.  From:  European Picture Service.

title: General MacArthur and John Foster Dulles
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur greets John Foster Dulles upon his arrival at Haneda Air Force Base, Tokyo, Japan from Korea. Mr. Dulles visited Syngman Rhee and conferred with General MacArthur. From: European Picture Service.

title: President Truman and Margaret on the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman board the U.S.S. Williamsburg for a cruise down the Potomac River.

title: General Walker and United Nations representative in Korea
Scopenote: The commanding General of the Armed Forces in Korea, Lieutenant General Walton Walker with Colonel Alford G. Katzin (ret.), personal representative of United Nations (U.N.) Secretary General Trygve Lie. Katzin had just presented the U.N. flag to General Walker.

title: A South Korean soldier and a fellow wounded soldier
Scopenote: A South Korean soldier comforts a wounded buddy before he is evacuated to the rear of the fighting lines.

title: African American G. I. eats from mess kit during Korean War
Scopenote: This G. I. digs into his mess kit full of hot field rations and looks mighty pleased, because a hot meal and a hot war are rarely found together.  African American G. I.

title: Soldiers manning a rocket launcher, Korean War
Scopenote: PFC Paul Cecil mans a rocket launcher as PFC Junior Coram loads a rocket on a ridge in the Chigong-Ni area of South Korea. Both men are from the 35th Infantry regiment.

title: American soldiers during the Korean War
Scopenote: Machine gun emplacement manned by American soldiers overlooking the main highway bridge across the Kap-ch'on River on the outskirts of Taejon.

title: South Korean soldiers maneuvering artillery
Scopenote: A 57-MM. anti-tank gun is moved into position by South Korean artillerymen.  Blistering artillery barrages were reported in advance of American and South Korean troops moving on the enemy.

title: Refugees in Korea
Scopenote: A long stream of refugees moves along a road leading south after receiving evacuation orders from the South Korean army. The South Korean forces were reported making small gains in a counter attack near the fallen city of Pohang.

title: A South Korean patrol
Scopenote: A South Korean infantry officer points out cover positions to his patrol working on the Korean battle front.

title: Charles Ross With Reporters
Scopenote: Press Secretary Charlie Ross informing reporters that Wake Island is to be the scene of a conference between President Truman and General Douglas MacArthur.

title: President Truman and General Vaughan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) and General Harry Vaughan (center) leave for Wake Island.  The other man in the photo is unidentified, but is possibly Secretary of the Treasury John Snyder.

title: Philip Jessup and Vernice Anderson in Hawaii on the Way to Wake Island
Scopenote: Left to right: Lieutenant Commander Dorothy Richard, United States Navy, secretary Vernice Anderson, and Ambassador-at-Large Philip C. Jessup in Hawaii on the way to Wake Island.

title: President Truman and General MacArthur at Wake Island
Scopenote: At dawn on the morning of October 15th, President Harry S. Truman is met at Wake Island by Far East Commander General Douglas MacArthur.

title: President Truman pinning medal on General MacArthur
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman awards Distinguished Service Medal, Fourth Oak Leaf Cluster, to General Douglas McArthur during the Wake Island Conference.

title: Portrait of Samuel Brightman
Scopenote: Samuel Brightman, Assistant Director of Publicity, Democratic National Committee, 1947-1952; Director of Publicity, DNC, 1952-1957.

title: President Truman giving morning mail dictation
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman giving morning mail dictation to Yeoman Second Class Emil Kesselman while on vacation in Key West, Florida, as photographers make pictures for still, movie, and television release.  Seated from left to right are President Truman and Yeoman Kesselman.  Kneeling, left to right: unidentified; George Skadding, Life; Bradford Kress, NBC; Henry Griffin, Associated Press; John Sandstone, Telenews.  Standing, left to right: unidentified; Frank Cancellari, ACME.

title: Truman With John Steelman in Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) eating lunch with John Steelman (left) on the lawn of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.

title: Key West Thanksgiving
Scopenote: Dining room of the Little White House in Key West, Florida, decorated for Thanksgiving. President Harry S. Truman, his family and members of his White House staff celebrated Thanksgiving in Key West during his vacation there.

title: President Harry S. Truman Shakes Hands with George M. Brown
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with United States Navy officer George M. Brown, just before his retirement on December 1, 1951. From left to right: Martin J. Bower, George M. Brown, Secret Service agent R. J. Jamison, President Truman, Captain Cecil Adell (mostly obscured), and Rear Admiral Robert Dennison. This ceremony took place during President Harry S. Truman's vacation to Key West, Florida, at the Boca Chica naval base.

title: President Truman and Margaret walking
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman on the way to the beach during a vacation in Key West, Florida, November 30, 1951.  From left to right, in front: President Truman, Margaret, and Captain Cecil Adell. In back from left to right: unidentified Secret Service agent, General Harry Vaughan, Stanley Woodward, Commander Horace D. Warden, and Donald Dawson.

title: Key West, Florida staff meeting with Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman has a staff meeting with, from left to right,  Admiral Robert Dennison, William Hassett, John Steelman, Joseph Short, and Irving Perlmeter while on vacation in Key West, Florida.

title: William Hassett and Joseph Short
Scopenote: William D. Hassett (left) and Joseph Short, two of the secretaries of President Harry S. Truman, on vacation with President Truman in Key West, Florida.  From the Papers of William D. Hassett, originals held by the Franklin D. Roosevelt Library.  The Harry S. Truman Library holds photocopies of the Hassett Papers.

title: William Hassett and Joseph Short
Scopenote: William D. Hassett (left) and Joseph Short, two of the secretaries of President Harry S. Truman, on vacation with President Truman in Key West, Florida. From the Papers of William D. Hassett, originals held by the Franklin D. Roosevelt Library. The Harry S. Truman Library holds photocopies of the Hassett Papers.

title: William Hassett and Joseph Short
Scopenote: William D. Hassett (left) and Joseph Short, two of the secretaries of President Harry S. Truman, on vacation with President Truman in Key West, Florida.  From the Papers of William D. Hassett, originals held by the Franklin D. Roosevelt Library.  The Harry S. Truman Library holds photocopies of the Hassett Papers.

title: Truman Receives Turkey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receives a 35 pound Christmas turkey from Springfield, Missouri. The turkey was presented to the President by Robert M. Calbert (left), President of the National Turkey Federation, who raised the bird. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman reading an address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman sitting at a desk in his Independence, Missouri home while reading an address in connection with the lighting of the National Community Christmas Tree on the White House grounds.

title: James McGranery
Scopenote: Portrait of Attorney General James P. McGranery.  Inscribed outside the border of the photograph: "To the Hon. Stephen A. Mitchell With the admiration and respect of James P. McGranery."

title: Sarah Churchill, Winston Churchill, and Margaret Truman at Anderson House
Scopenote: Left to right: Sarah Churchill, British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, and Margaret Truman attend a dinner at Anderson House in Washington, DC, given by Secretary of State Dean Acheson (not pictured).

title: Profile of Truman in hat
Scopenote: The soft brim of President Harry S. Truman's hat turns up in the stiff wind at Washington Airport as he awaited the arrival of Secretary of State Dean Acheson from Lisbon.  From: Houston Post

title: President Harry S. Truman Presents Medal of Honor to First Lieutenant Lloyd Burke
Scopenote: At a ceremony at the White House, President Harry S. Truman is shown presenting the Congressional Medal of Honor to U.S. Army First Lieutenant Lloyd L. Burke, Stuttgart, Arkansas.  This award was given for his bravery displayed during the Korean War. Burke's son, Gary Lee, on the right, is being held by the honoree's mother, Mrs. Betty M. Burke.  Lt. Burke's wife, Virginia, is standing directly behind him.  Others watching the ceremony standing in the back include left to right:  General Omar N. Bradley, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, far left; Arkansas Senator William Fulbright, third from left; Arkansas Representative William F. Norrell, fourth from the left; Frank Pace, Secretary of the Army, sixth from the left; Dan A. Kimball, Secretary of the Navy, eighth from the left; Alabama Senator Lister Hill, ninth from the left; and Robert A. Lovett, Secretary of Defense, far right. All others are unidentified.

title: President Truman Shakes Hands With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman congratulates three soldiers who fought in the Korean War after he presented them with the Congressional Medal of Honor in a ceremony in the Rose Garden of the White House. From left to right: Marine Master Sergeant Harold E. Wilson, Birmingham, Alabama; President Truman; Army Lieutenant Lloyd L. Burke, Stuttgart, Arkansas; and Army Corporal Rodolfo P. Hernandez, Fowler, California. Various unidentified family members present at the ceremony stand directly behind them. Those identified on the back top row include, from left to right: General Omar N. Bradley, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, far left; Arkansas Representative William F. Norrell, 5th from the left; Frank Pace, Secretary of the Army, 6th from the left; Alabama Senator Lister Hill, 3rd from the right; Dan A. Kimball, Secretary of the Navy, 2nd from the right; and Robert A. Lovett, Secretary of Defense, far right.

title: Portrait John R. Steelman
Scopenote: Portrait of John R. Steelman used in his oral history interview.

title: John R. Steelman
Scopenote: Portrait of John R. Steelman.

title: The Truman family at the White House at Christmas
Scopenote: From left to right, First Lady Bess Wallace Truman, President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman at the Christmas tree lighting ceremonies at the White House. They are standing in the doorway of the White House.

title: Jesse Donaldson
Scopenote: Portrait of Jesse M. Donaldson, Postmaster General, 1947-1953.  Inscribed outside border of the photograph: "J. M. Donaldson Postmaster General Dec. 16, 1947-Jan. 20, 1953".

title: Portrait of Oscar Ewing
Scopenote: Portrait of Oscar Ewing, Federal Security Administrator. The bottom border of the photo is autographed: "To my good friend, Steve Mitchell, with warm personal regards. Oscar R. Ewing, Washington, January 19, 1953."

title: Mrs. Bess W. Truman Receiving a Platter
Scopenote: Bess Truman poses outdoors with the wives of the Cabinet members during a luncheon at the home of former Secretary of State Dean Acheson. She is holding a large platter that was presented to her from the Cabinet wives. From left to right: Adele (Mrs. Robert) Lovett; Eda (Mrs. Charles) Brannan; Alice (Mrs. Dean) Acheson; Jane (Mrs. Alben) Barkley; Ann (Mrs. Oscar)  Chapman; Bess W. Truman; Evlyn (Mrs. John) Snyder; Regina (Mrs. James) McGranery; Elizabeth (Mrs. Charles) Sawyer (mostly obscured); Helen (Mrs. Maurice) Tobin; Margaret (Mrs. Frank) Pace; Nell (Mrs. Jesse) Donaldson; unidentified.

title: Ribbon Cutting Ceremonies for a Section of Truman Road in Independence
Scopenote: Ribbon cutting ceremonies for a new section of Truman Road in Independence, Missouri.  Bess Truman can be seen in the center of the photo. The photo was taken on Main Street near the fire station.   Donor:  Paul Renshaw.

title: President Truman at Ribbon-Cutting Ceremonies for Truman Road
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at ribbon-cutting ceremonies for a new section of Truman Road through Independence, Missouri.  Standing to the left of President Truman is Mayor Robert Weatherford and Mr. Truman's brother, Vivian Truman.  The man with his back to the camera is unidentified.  They are at Truman Road and Main Street; the old fire station is behind them.

title: Mrs. Truman and Unidentified Woman
Scopenote: Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman (left) and an unidentified woman standing in front of a car, probably at a parade.  Paul Renshaw is an Independence, Missouri photographer.  Donor: Paul Renshaw.

title: Backyard of Truman Home at Time of Margaret Truman's Wedding
Scopenote: This picture shows the garage and backyard of the Truman home at the time of Margaret Truman's wedding.  There is an umbrella and a few people visible.  There is a car in front of the garage.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with Mrs. W. L. C. Palmer
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) and former First Lady Bess W. Truman (right) stand with their former high school teacher, Ardelia (Mrs. W. L. C.) Palmer (left). They are attending a dinner for the Beta Sigma Phi (Association for Women in Communications) dinner.

title: Former President Truman with Edward R. Murrow at Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Edward R. Murrow photographed with former president Harry S. Truman at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.

title: Portrait of Ralph Block
Scopenote: Portrait of Ralph Block used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Block.

title: Mrs. Roosevelt and Mrs. Truman at the Truman Library
Scopenote: From left to right, Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt and Mrs. Bess Wallace Truman at the Truman Library.

title: Mrs. Roosevelt and unidentified ladies at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Mrs. Eleanor Roosevelt greeting unidentified ladies during a visit to the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Truman Statue, Athens, Greece
Scopenote: A statue of President Harry S. Truman in Athens, Greece.  From: Morton Dean Joyce.

title: Portrait of Kenneth Birkhead
Scopenote: Kenneth Birkhead, Associate Director of Public Relations for the Research Division of the Democratic National Committee during the 1948 presidential campaign.

title: The Seal of the President
Scopenote: The Seal of the President of the United States at the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library, Independence, MO.  Permission to use presidential seal must be obtained from the White House Legal Counsel's Office.

title: Noland Home
Scopenote: Home of Margaret Ellen Truman Noland and her daughters, Mary Ethel and Nellie Noland, at 216 North Delaware, Independence, Missouri. Mary Ethel and Nellie were cousins of Harry S. Truman.
